Primary Contact: Andrea Sage, Manager of Employment Programs; Phone: 250.317.9864; Email: andrea.sage@jhscso.bc.ca
Service Details: - Offers innovative employment training program, provided in partnership with Fortis BC that specializes in energy efficiency, upgrades and retrofitting- Targets individuals who have little or no experience in the formal labour market and struggle with barriers to employment - Participants receive 3 months of intensive employability training comprised of pre-program planning/motivational enhancement, classroom teaching, on-the-job field training, and post-graduate follow-up support- Graduates receive WHMIS, Fall Protection, First Aid/CPR, and Construction Safety Training System certification
Eligibility: Ages: 18 year(s) and up- Accepts referrals from community agencies and self-referrals of individuals who are: over the age of 18, are either unemployed or underemployed, have little or no experience in the formal labour market, are disconnected from the workforce, are ineligible for EI or Reachback status, are experiencing barriers to employment (including working towards managing mental health and/or addiction issues)- Must be physically able and motivated to work in the Trades field
How to Apply: - Referral forms available from the website- Submit completed forms by fax or mail to the attention of Employment Services
Major Intersection: St Paul St and Bernard Ave
